title: Haskell: Some Awesome Language Extensions Explained
summary: A living post, partly for my own reference, containing details of some of the more awesome/useful/interesting looking Haskell language extensions with plenty of examples. I'll update it as I have more to add.

title: Haskell: A Look at the Continuation Monad
summary: Some notes I developed on the continuation monad in Haskell as a result of exploring how they work and how to use them, complete with plenty of examples along the way.

title: An introduction to parsing text in Haskell with Parsec
summary: Parsec makes parsing text very easy in Haskell. I write this as much for myself as for anyone else to have a tutorial and reference which starts from the ground up and works through how each function can be used with examples all the way.

title: Angular and React: A Tale of Two Frameworks
summary: Having used Angular pretty heavily for over a year at work and more recently ReactJS from Facebook in rebuilding my website, I thought I'd share my views on how they compare.

title: Haskell: Another Lens Tutorial
summary: As someone who just got lenses after several days of trying to find out about them, I thought I'd reflect on this new understanding by showing you what a lens really is, starting from scratch.

title: Haskell, and Why It Might Just Be My New Favourite Language
summary: Coming from imperative programming languages like Javascript, Haskell might just be the most different language out there for me to learn, but here are several reasons why it also might be one of the best.

title: AngularJS: Demystifying Services and Dependency Injection
summary: This post is my attempt to unravel the mystery often surrounding the difference between services, providers, values and the like in Angular. I then run through how dependency injection works, building a plain Javascript example along the way.

title: Website Reboot: Version Three
summary: Welcome to the third incarnation of my website, this time built to be simple, slick, and to the point.

title: Enigma #1749
summary: A quick look at New Scientist Enigma number 1749, with a simple solution in Javascript.

title: Two Handy Tools to Help Build an AJAX Site
summary: Two utilities I built for a pre-Angular (or Ember) website, which help with routing URL requests to function calls, and storing/monitoring state in a tree structure.

title: Rick Astley Inspired Self-decompressing Text Compressor
summary: A bit of code-golf inspired fun: introducing a Javascript snippet and tool to build it that when executed, prints out the lyrics to a well known song.

title: Web App: Competitive Learner
summary: One of my first Javascript based applications, the Competitive Learner, is based on algorithms I built on during my PhD. Draw shapes, and see how it learns!

title: Web App: Fractal Explorer
summary: A post describing my Javascript Fractal Explorer, with a link to the real thing so you can go have a play from the comfort of your browser.

title: Web App: Compression Machine
summary: In this post I describe and link you to my Javascript compression machine, which makes use of several compression techniques described in other posts. Have a play!

title: Sequitur: a templated C++ implementation
summary: In this post I briefly describe my C++ implementation of the lesser known Sequitur compression algorithm, and provide some usage examples. The source code is available to use however you wish.

title: C++ Optimization: Making use of Memory Pools
summary: Utilising memory pools can be one of the most significant optimisations you can make to a C++ program. Here, I walk through building and using one from the ground up.

title: Compression Algorithms: Sequitur
summary: An introduction to the Sequitur compression algorithm with an updated algorithm describing how it works, along with the common pitfalls in implementing it.

title: C++11: An Introduction to Some of the Fun New Additions
summary: A pretty comprehensive introduction to a large proportion of the new features of C++11. This is to help refresh my mind as much as any, but it's a good place to start, and full of examples.

title: An Introduction to Lambda Calculus
summary: A pretty in depth introduction to Lambda Calculus, the precursor to modern functional programming as well as some crazy esoteric programming languages like Iota and Jot.

title: Compression Algorithms: Huffman Coding
summary: A look at a simple form of compression known as Huffman Coding that is frequently combined with other techniques, and easy to implement. I walk through an example and provide a full description of how it all works.

title: Welcome to unbui.lt!
summary: An introductory post to celebrate the launch of my new website.
